zc.thread
Interface SharedQueue

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSharedQueue
public interface SharedQueue

A fully synchronized object container aimed for inter-thread communication. SharedQueue are frequently used in concurrent systems to smooth out information transfer rates between the producers of data and the consumers of that data.

This container is often known as a Buffer or a BoundedBuffer, but the SharedQueue name emphasize the FIFO nature of the container and the fact that it is shared between multiple threads.

Method Summary
 void add(java.lang.Object inObject)
          Add an object into this SharedQueue and notify waiting threads.
 int capacity()
          Return the maximum number of object that can be held in this SharedQueue, that is the capacity beyond which add(java.lang.Object) will block.
 void clear()
          Removes all the objects from this SharedQueue.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Tests if this SharedQueue is currently empty.
 boolean isFull()
          Tests if this SharedQueue is currently full.
 java.lang.Object remove()
          Remove and return the "next" available object from this SharedQueue and notify waiting threads.
 int size()
          Returns the number of objects currently enqueued in this SharedQueue.
 

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Removes all the objects from this SharedQueue.

The SharedQueue will be empty after this call returns.

add

public void add(java.lang.Object inObject)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Add an object into this SharedQueue and notify waiting threads. May block the calling thread if the queue has reach its maximum capacity.
Parameters:
inObject - the object to enqueue.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inObject is null.

remove

public java.lang.Object remove()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Remove and return the "next" available object from this SharedQueue and notify waiting threads. May block the calling thread if the queue is empty.
Returns:
the "next" object in the queue.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.

capacity

public int capacity()
Return the maximum number of object that can be held in this SharedQueue, that is the capacity beyond which add(java.lang.Object) will block.
Returns:
an int > zero.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of objects currently enqueued in this SharedQueue.

NOTE: This is only a snapshot value, that may have changed before returning.

Returns:
an int >= zero.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tests if this SharedQueue is currently empty.

NOTE: This is only a snapshot value, that may have changed before returning.

Returns:
true if and only if this SharedQueue has no objects, that is, its size is zero; false otherwise.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Tests if this SharedQueue is currently full.

NOTE: This is only a snapshot value, that may have changed before returning.

Returns:
true if and only if this SharedQueue has no free slots, that is, no more objects can be put into it; false otherwise.
